content:
<ce:para view="all">[{Gd(NMP)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>}(PMo<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">40</ce:inf>)]<ce:inf loc="post">
<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>
</ce:inf>. The formation of heteropolyacid gadolinium salts was realized by neutralization of the acids. α-H<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>PMo<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">40</ce:inf>·<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (3.8 g, 2 mmol) and GdCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (2 mmol) were dissolved in 15 ml water, and the solution was heated at a 80 °C water bath until being dry. Then 2 ml NMP was added to dried solid (2 g) from the first stage with stirring until the mixture being paste. After standing for a while, the paste was dissolved in enough amount of acetonitrile–water mixture (3:2 <ce:italic>v</ce:italic>/<ce:italic>v</ce:italic>). Finally, the solution was filtered and left to evaporate at room temperature. One or two days later, yellow crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction were obtained: yield based on α-H<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>PMo<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">40</ce:inf>·<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O: about 80%. Elemental analysis, found (%) C, 14.09; H, 2.20; N, 3.49; calculated for [{Gd(NMP)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>}(PMo<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">40</ce:inf>)]<ce:inf loc="post">
<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>
</ce:inf> (%); C, 13.98; H, 2.10; N, 3.26. Weight loss of 22.5% below 550 °C without obvious endothermic peak and with two exothermic peaks at 300 °C (where the Gd–O bonds break with the oxidation of NMP molecules) and 473 °C (where the heteropoly anionic cages decompose to the lower oxides of the metals like MoO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>). Calc. 23.26% for six NMP for the title compound.</ce:para>
clean_text: [{Gd(NMP)6}(PMo12O40)] n . The formation of heteropolyacid gadolinium salts was realized by neutralization of the acids. α-H3PMo12O40⋅nH2O (3.8 g, 2 mmol) and GdCl3 (2 mmol) were dissolved in 15 ml water, and the solution was heated at a 80 °C water bath until being dry. Then 2 ml NMP was added to dried solid (2 g) from the first stage with stirring until the mixture being paste. After standing for a while, the paste was dissolved in enough amount of acetonitrile-water mixture (3:2 v/v). Finally, the solution was filtered and left to evaporate at room temperature. One or two days later, yellow crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction were obtained: yield based on α-H3PMo12O40⋅nH2O: about 80%. Elemental analysis, found (%) C, 14.09; H, 2.20; N, 3.49; calculated for [{Gd(NMP)6}(PMo12O40)] n  (%); C, 13.98; H, 2.10; N, 3.26. Weight loss of 22.5% below 550 °C without obvious endothermic peak and with two exothermic peaks at 300 °C (where the Gd-O bonds break with the oxidation of NMP molecules) and 473 °C (where the heteropoly anionic cages decompose to the lower oxides of the metals like MoO3). Calc. 23.26% for six NMP for the title compound.
